info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud FIN - Joint Venture Transactions
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials â€” Joint Venture Transactions module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Joint Venture Transactions
Get a joint venture transaction change

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Joint Venture Transactions resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Joint Venture Transactions. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Joint Venture Transactions collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Joint Venture Transactions to get the hash key.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Joint Venture Transaction Changes resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Joint Venture Transaction Changes. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Joint Venture Transaction Changes collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Joint Venture Transaction Changes to get the hash key.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • SysEffectiveDate; string
  • afterAssignmentRule; string; The new ownership definition assignment rule assigned to the transaction.
  • afterDistributionOnlyFlag; boolean; The new distribution only value assigned to the transaction.
  • afterExpenditureBusinessUnit; string; The new expenditure business unit assigned to the transaction.
  • afterExpenditureItemDate; string; The new expenditure item date assigned to the transaction.
  • afterExpenditureOganization; string; The new expenditure organization assigned to the transaction.
  • afterExpenditureType; string; The new expenditure type assigned to the transaction.
  • afterExpenditureTypeDescription; string; The description of the new expenditure type assigned to the transaction.
  • afterOwnershipDefinition; string; The new ownership definition assigned to the transaction.
  • afterProject; string; The name of the new project assigned to the transaction.
  • afterProjectNumber; string; The new project number assigned to the transaction.
  • afterStakeholder; string; The new name of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the transaction.
  • afterStakeholderDescription; string; The new description of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the transaction.
  • afterStatus; string; The new status assigned to the transaction.
  • afterTask; string; The name of the new task assigned to the transaction.
  • afterTaskNumber; string; The new task number assigned to the transaction.
  • afterTransactionDate; string; The new transaction date assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeAssignmentRule; string; The previous ownership definition assignment rule assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeDistributionOnlyFlag; boolean; The previous distribution only value assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeExpenditureBusinessUnit; string; The previous expenditure business unit assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeExpenditureItemDate; string; The previous expenditure item date assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeExpenditureOrganization; string; The previous expenditure organization assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeExpenditureType; string; The previous expenditure type assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeExpenditureTypeDescription; string; The description of the previous expenditure type assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeOwnershipDefinition; string; The previous ownership definition assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeProject; string; The name of the previous project assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeProjectNumber; string; The previous project number assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeStakeholder; string; The previous name of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeStakeholderDescription; string; The previous description of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeStatus; string; The previous status assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeTask; string; The name of the previous task assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeTaskNumber; string; The previous task number assigned to the transaction.
  • beforeTransactionDate; string; The previous transaction date assigned to the transaction.
  • changeReason; string; The reason for the manual change to the joint venture transaction.
  • changeReasonDetails; string; Additional text to describe the reason the joint venture transaction was manually changed.
  • createdBy; string; The user who created the joint venture transaction change.
  • creationDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture transaction change was created.
  • transactionChangeId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture transaction change.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the transaction change that matches the primary key criteria specified.
    Finder Variables
    • transactionChangeId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture transaction change.

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

variable.description: (Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Joint Venture Transactions resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Joint Venture Transactions. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Joint Venture Transactions collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Joint Venture Transactions to get the hash key.

response.name: No Content. This task does not return elements in the response body.

More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

variable.description: (Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Joint Venture Transactions resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Joint Venture Transactions. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Joint Venture Transactions collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Joint Venture Transactions to get the hash key.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

  • accountedCredit; number; The transaction credit amount in accounting currency.
  • accountedDebit; number; The transaction debit amount in accounting currency.
  • accountingClassCode; string; The accounting classification of the joint venture transaction.
  • accountingCurrency; string; The currency of the transaction amount.
  • accountingDate; string; The date used to determine the accounting period for the transaction.
  • accountingPeriod; string; The name of the fiscal period that the joint venture transaction is associated with.
  • agreement; string; The name of the carried interest agreement associated with the joint venture transaction.
  • agreementDescription; string; The description of the carried interest agreement associated with the joint venture transaction.
  • assignmentRule; string; The name of the ownership definition assignment rule used to assign the ownership definition or direct billed stakeholder.
  • assignmentRuleDescription; string; The description of the ownership definition assignment rule.
  • basisSource; string; The source of the overhead calculation amount.
  • businessUnit; string; The name of the business unit associated with the joint venture.
  • createdBy; string; The user who created the joint venture transaction.
  • createdByJointVentureFlag; boolean; A flag indicating whether the source of the transaction is a joint venture invoice or journal created by joint venture processing. The source of the transaction can also be payments or receipts against an invoice created by joint venture processing.
  • creationDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture transaction was created.
  • directBilledStakeholder; string; The name of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • directBilledStakeholderDescription; string; The description of the direct billed stakeholder.
  • distributionOnlyFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the transaction is for distribution only, not for invoicing.
  • distributionType; string; Determines whether the distributed transaction is billable or payable to the stakeholder when processed through invoicing and internal transfer journals.
  • enteredCredit; number; The transaction credit amount in the entered currency.
  • enteredCurrency; string; The currency code entered on the original transaction.
  • enteredDebit; number; The transaction debit amount in the entered currency.
  • eventTypeCode; string; The event type of the subledger transaction.
  • expenditureBusinessUnit; string; The name of the expenditure business unit in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureItemDate; string; The date of the expenditure in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureOrganization; string; The name of the expenditure organization in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
  • expenditureType; string; The name identifying the expenditure classification.
  • expenditureTypeDescription; string; The description of the expenditure type.
  • headerId; integer; The unique identifier of the original transaction
  • jointVenture; string; The unique name of the joint venture.
  • jointVentureDescription; string; The description of the joint venture.
  • lastUpdateDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture transaction was last updated.
  • lastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the joint venture transaction.
  • ledger; string; The name of the ledger.
  • lineNumber; integer; The number of the line in the original transaction.
  • method; string; The unique name of the overhead method.
  • methodDescription; string; The description of the overhead method.
  • methodEndDate; string; The end date of the overhead method effective date range.
  • methodStartDate; string; The start date of the overhead method effective date range.
  • netAccounted; number; The net transaction amount in the accounting currency.
  • netEntered; number; The net transaction amount in the entered currency.
  • notes; string; Additional details about the joint venture source transaction.
  • originalDirectBilledStakeholder; string; The name of the original direct billed stakeholder assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • originalDirectBilledStakeholderDescription; string; The description of the original direct billed stakeholder.
  • originalOwnershipDefinition; string; The original ownership definition assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • ownershipDefinition; string; The name of the ownership definition assigned to the transaction, which can be overridden.
  • project; string; The name of the project.
  • projectNumber; string; The unique identifier of the project.
  • source; string; The name of the application the transaction originated from, for example Payables or Cost Management.
  • sourceReferenceNumber; string; The reference number for the source transaction, such as supplier invoice number from Payables.
  • status; string; The status of the joint venture transaction.
  • task; string; The name of the project task representing a subdivision of work.
  • taskNumber; string; The unique number of the project task.
  • transactionDate; string; The date when the joint venture source transaction occurred.
  • transactionDescription; string; The description to include on the transactions created through invoice or internal transfer journal processing.
  • transactionId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture transaction.
  • transactionSource; string; The source of the joint venture transaction, for example general ledger, subledger accounting, or joint venture.
  • transactionType; string; The type of transaction to be processed, such as expense, revenue, asset, overhead, and so forth.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the joint venture transaction that matches the primary key criteria specified.
    Finder Variables
    • transactionId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture transaction.
  • transactionFinder Finds all joint venture transactions that match the specified search criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • SysEffectiveDate; string;

    • createdByJointVentureFlag; string; A flag indicating whether the source; string; of the transaction is a joint venture invoice or journal created by joint venture processing. The source; string; of the transaction can also be payments or receipts against an invoice created by joint venture processing.

This query parameter is used to fetch resources which are effective dated as of the specified start date. The value of this query parameter is a string having a date in yyyy-MM-dd format

  • methodEndDate; string; The end date of the overhead method effective date range.
  • methodStartDate; string; The start date of the overhead method effective date range.
  • netAccounted; number; The net transaction amount in the accounting currency.
  • netEntered; number; The net transaction amount in the entered currency.
  • notes; string; Additional details about the joint venture source transaction.
  • originalDirectBilledStakeholder; string; The name of the original direct billed stakeholder assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • originalDirectBilledStakeholderDescription; string; The description of the original direct billed stakeholder.
  • originalOwnershipDefinition; string; The original ownership definition assigned to the joint venture transaction.
  • ownershipDefinition; string; The name of the ownership definition assigned to the transaction, which can be overridden.
  • project; string; The name of the project.
  • projectNumber; string; The unique identifier of the project.
  • source; string; The name of the application the transaction originated from, for example Payables or Cost Management.
  • sourceReferenceNumber; string; The reference number for the source transaction, such as supplier invoice number from Payables.
  • status; string; The status of the joint venture transaction.
  • task; string; The name of the project task representing a subdivision of work.
  • taskNumber; string; The unique number of the project task.
  • transactionDate; string; The date when the joint venture source transaction occurred.
  • transactionDescription; string; The description to include on the transactions created through invoice or internal transfer journal processing.
  • transactionId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture transaction.
  • transactionSource; string; The source of the joint venture transaction, for example general ledger, subledger accounting, or joint venture.
  • transactionType; string; The type of transaction to be processed, such as expense, revenue, asset, overhead, and so forth.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the joint venture transaction that matches the primary key criteria specified.
    Finder Variables
    • transactionId; integer; The unique identifier of the joint venture transaction.
  • transactionFinder Finds all joint venture transactions that match the specified search criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • SysEffectiveDate; string;
    • accountingDate; string; The date used to determine the accounting period for the transaction.
    • accountingPeriod; string; The name of the fiscal period that the joint venture transaction is associated with.
    • agreement; string; The name of the carried interest agreement; string; associated with the joint venture transaction.
    • assignmentRule; string; The name of the ownership definition assignment rule used to assign the ownership definition or direct billed stakeholder.
    • basisSource; string; The source; string; of the overhead calculation amount.
    • createdBy; string; The user who created the joint venture transaction.
    • createdByJointVentureFlag; string; A flag indicating whether the source; string; of the transaction is a joint venture invoice or journal created by joint venture processing. The source; string; of the transaction can also be payments or receipts against an invoice created by joint venture processing.
    • creationDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture transaction was created.
    • directBilledStakeholder; string; The name of the direct billed stakeholder assigned to the joint venture transaction.
    • distributionType; string; Determines whether the distributed transaction is billable or payable to the stakeholder when processed through invoicing and internal transfer journals.
    • expenditureBusinessUnit; string; The name of the expenditure business unit in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
    • expenditureItemDate; string; The date of the expenditure in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
    • expenditureOrganization; string; The name of the expenditure organization in Project Costing that's associated with the subledger accounting entry for the joint venture transaction.
    • expenditureType; string; The name identifying the expenditure classification.
    • jointVenture; string; The unique name of the joint venture.
    • lastUpdateDate; string; The date and time when the joint venture transaction was last updated.
    • lastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the joint venture transaction.
    • ledger; string; The name of the ledger; string; .
    • method; string; The unique name of the overhead method; string; .
    • originalDirectBilledStakeholder; string; The name of the original direct billed stakeholder assigned to the joint venture transaction.
    • originalOwnershipDefinition; string; The original ownership definition assigned to the joint venture transaction.
    • ownershipDefinition; string; The name of the ownership definition assigned to the transaction, which can be overridden.
    • project; string; The name of the project; string; .
    • projectNumber; string; The unique identifier of the project; string; .
    • searchAllText; string; A search value to identify joint venture transactions that contain the specified text in any of the string attributes.
    • source; string; The name of the application the transaction originated from, for example Payables or Cost Management.
    • status; string; The status; string; of the joint venture transaction.
    • task; string; The name of the project; string; task; string; representing a subdivision of work.
    • taskNumber; string; The unique number of the project; string; task; string; .
    • transactionDate; string; The date when the joint venture source; string; transaction occurred.
    • transactionDescription; string; The description to include on the transactions created through invoice or internal transfer journal processing.
    • transactionType; string; The type of transaction to be processed, such as expense, revenue, asset, overhead, and so forth.
This query parameter is used to fetch resources which are effective dated as of the specified start date. The value of this query parameter is a string having a date in yyyy-MM-dd format

item.description: The joint venture transactions resource is used to view, update, or delete joint venture transactions.
